The third row ("row_index": 2) does not match since its grass value is "1 - 0" (not "0 - 0").
The fourth row ("row_index": 3) does not match since it has a clay value of "2 - 0".
The fifth row ("row_index": 4) does not match since its record value is "2 - 1" (not "1 - 0").
The sixth row ("row_index": 5) does not match since its carpet value is "1 - 3".
The seventh row ("row_index": 6) matches the conditions as it has "hard": "1 - 0", "clay": "0 - 0", "grass": "0 - 0", "carpet": "0 - 0" and "record": "1 - 0".
The eighth row ("row_index": 7) does not match since its grass value is "1 - 0".
The ninth row ("row_index": 8) matches the conditions as it has "hard": "1 - 0", "clay": "0 - 0", "grass": "0 - 0", "carpet": "0 - 0" and "record": "1 - 0".
The tenth row ("row_index": 9) does not match since its record value is "1 - 1".
The eleventh row ("row_index": 10) matches the conditions as it has "hard": "1 - 0", "clay": "0 - 0", "grass": "0 - 0", "carpet": "0 - 0" and "record": "1 - 0".

4. Since we found two matching rows, the claim is not conclusively true as there are multiple valid options. However, if we want to interpret this claim in a way that only one match is allowed, then the answer would be FALSE since the table does not contain a unique row with the specified conditions.
